text:
The Galactic Centre (or Galactic Center) is the rotational center of the Milky Way galaxy.
It is a supermassive black hole of 4.100 ± 0.034 million solar masses. It powers the compact radio source Sagittarius A*.
It is away from Earth in the direction of the constellations Sagittarius, Ophiuchus, and Scorpius where the Milky Way appears brightest.
